alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 10:48AM EDT until July 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Central Ohio, including the following county, Franklin OH. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1046 AM EDT, the public reported minor flooding lingering in the advisory area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen in the past 30 hours. Lingering high water due to earlier excessive rainfall will may be slow to recede. Additional storms are moving back into the advisory area through early afternoon that may worsen ongoing flooding issues in the area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Columbus, Dublin, Westerville, Reynoldsburg, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Gahanna, Hilliard, Pickerington, Worthington, Bexley, Canal Winchester, Groveport, West Jefferson, Minerva Park, Ohio State University, Easton, Lake Darby, Whitehall and New Albany.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
